Shapes

Triangles

Triangles can be rendered in CSS using mixins. For example the down triangle mixin .shape-triangle-down-el(@width, @height: @width, @color: @brand-primary, @border-color: false, @border-width: 1px). The only required parameter is @width. Triangles can optionally have a border color if @border-color is a valid CSS color. This mixin uses :before and :after pseudo elements.

Simple Triangles

If you do not require borders on triangles then you can use the simpler .shape-triangle-down-el(@width, @height: @width, @color: @brand-primary) mixin. The benifit of this is that you can apply the shape to a pseudo element of your choosing.
